koohiiStory1: Traditional Japanese storefront doors have several flags, known as "noren," hanging down from a curtain rod in front of them. I see this as a pseudo-pictograph, and use the horizontal line across the top to represent the curtain rod, since noren donÂ´t usually hang from the ceiling.
koohiiStory2: A Japanese door has a noren, a flag hanging from a rod. (I give this primitive the meaning of a noren-covered door).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The radical and the kanji for door are the same!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Time to open the door to the reading part of this mnemonic.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You open the door and immediately get it closed back on your toe (ã¨), literally causing your toe to explode.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the pain of your toe going away. Think about the other side of the door, where your toe is probably rolling around after it blasted off your foot.

Radicals: æˆ¸  (door)
Meaning Mnemonic
The radical and the kanji for door are the same!
Time to open the door to the reading part of this mnemonic.
Reading Mnemonic
You open the door and immediately get it closed back on your toe (ã¨), literally causing your toe to explode.
Feel the pain of your toe going away. Think about the other side of the door, where your toe is probably rolling around after it blasted off your foot.
